SENT.plain: A 72-year-old woman developed three consecutive processes that showed characteristics of different neutrophilic dermatoses
First, she developed a picture resembling granuloma faciale, followed by a Sweet's syndrome-like eruption, and then by a superficial pyoderma gangrenosum
She was later diagnosed with myelodysplastic syndrome
This case demonstrates that neutrophilic dermatoses form a spectrum of entities that do not necessarily occur in isolation
